title: Daniel Ellsberg - State Department (Department of Defense, Office of the Secretary of Defense)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records related to Daniel Ellsberg, the political activist, former US military analyst, and former RAND Corporation researcher employee who leaked the Pentagon Papers to the press in 1971. On June 16, 2023 he died: https://www.washingtonpost.com/obituaries/2023/06/16/daniel-ellsberg-pentagon-papers-dead/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Silverman

title: Michael Ryan Davis (aka Mike Davis) (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All files on Michael Ryan Davis, professionally known as Mike Davis, a political activist, writer, and historian who wrote frequently about California. Davis lived March 10, 1946 – October 25, 2022, and his death was widely reported in the media.

https://www.npr.org/2022/10/26/1131578207/writer-truck-driver-meatcutter-and-prophet-of-compassion-mike-davis-dies-at-76

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Silverman

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All files on former Italian Prime minister and media magnate Silvio Berlusconi, 29 September 1936 – 12 June 2023. His death has been widely reported in the media.

https://www.nytimes.com/2023/06/12/world/europe/silvio-berlusconi-dead.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Silverman
